text.__SUMMARY__: Gymnopilus hispidellus is a species of mushroom in the Cortinariaceae family.
text.Description: The cap is 2 to 4 centimetres (0.8 to 1.6 in) in diameter.
text.Habitat and distribution: This species has been found growing scattered or subcespitose (with stems clumped together), on logs, in Cuba in March.
text.Phylogeny: Gymnopilus hispidellus  is in the aeruginosus-luteofolius infrageneric grouping.
